application

Class ManagerScreenModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.LoginModel
      • application.StaffScreenModel
        • application.ManagerScreenModel

  • public class ManagerScreenModel
extends StaffScreenModel
    This class handles the SQLite queries and database interactions needed for the manager screen, ManagerScreenController inputs are passed to methods in this class The methods and structure of this class are derived from the tutorials available from the ProgrammingKnowledge playlist JavaFX tutorial for beginners : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9YrmON6nlEw&list=PLS1QulWo1RIaUGP446_pWLgTZPiFizEMq This class makes use of a 3rd party library, the SQLite JDBC Driver available from https://bitbucket.org/xerial/sqlite-jdbc/downloads
    Author:
    jarrod joshua

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.sql.Connection connection 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ManagerScreenModel()
      The class constructor establishes a connection with the database or exits the program if no connection is found

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) void addNewDishToMenuDB(java.lang.String name, double cost)
      Takes a name string and price double and inserts a new Food item into the menu table of the database.
      (package private) void addStaffAccountIntoDB(int id, java.lang.String user, java.lang.String pw, java.lang.String managerVerified)
      Takes an integer id number, and strings for the username, password and isManager fields of a Staff object, then add these as a new record into the database staff table.
      (package private) void deleteDishFromMenuDB(java.lang.String name, double cost)
      Takes a name string and price double then searches the table menu and and deletes the corresponding Food item from the menu table of the database.
      (package private) void deleteStaffAccountFromDB(int id, java.lang.String user, java.lang.String pw, java.lang.String managerVerified)
      Takes an integer id number, and strings for the username, password and isManager fields of a Staff object, then finds a corresponding record in the staff table of the database and deletes the record corresponding to the all the inputs.
      (package private) java.util.ArrayList<ActivityLog> getActivityLogForEmployee(java.lang.String user)
      Takes a username string and queries the database to find a list of activity logs recorded from the corresponding staff account
      (package private) java.util.ArrayList<Staff> getAllEmployeesFromDB()
      Queries the database to retrieve all staff account elements and output an ArrayList containing all Staff record and objects associated with the system
      (package private) java.util.ArrayList<Order> getAllOrders()
      Searches both stored orders and (working) orders tables for all of their records and returns an ArrayList containing every order in the system ready for display in a table
      (package private) boolean isDbConnected()
      returns a boolean true if the database is connected or false if it is not.
      void saveActivityEntryToDB(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String act, java.lang.String timestamp)
      Takes string inputs from the GUI prompts for the username, activity description, and time stamp, then inserts a new record with all of these into the activityLog table for managers to track.
      (package private) void saveImportToDB(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Order> csvImport)
      Takes a list of order objects (in this context imported from a CSV file) and then saves each of them into the stored records table in the database

      • getAllEmployeesFromDB

        java.util.ArrayList<Staff> getAllEmployeesFromDB()
                                          throws java.sql.SQLException

        ArrayList targetStaff a list of all staff objects in the database

      • addStaffAccountIntoDB

        void addStaffAccountIntoDB(int id,
                           java.lang.String user,
                           java.lang.String pw,
                           java.lang.String managerVerified)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Takes an integer id number, and strings for the username, password and isManager fields of a Staff object, then add these as a new record into the database staff table.
        Parameters:
        id - : int number specifying the id attribute of this Staff object and its account
        user - : String specifying the username field of the Staff object
        pw - : String specifying the password field of the Staff object
        managerVerified - : String specifying if the staff account has manager access permission ("true") or if not ("false")
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • deleteStaffAccountFromDB

        void deleteStaffAccountFromDB(int id,
                              java.lang.String user,
                              java.lang.String pw,
                              java.lang.String managerVerified)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Takes an integer id number, and strings for the username, password and isManager fields of a Staff object, then finds a corresponding record in the staff table of the database and deletes the record corresponding to the all the inputs.
        Parameters:
        id - : int number specifying the id attribute of this Staff object and its account
        user - : String specifying the username field of the Staff object
        pw - : String specifying the password field of the Staff object
        managerVerified - : String specifying if the staff account has manager access permission ("true") or if not ("false")
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getActivityLogForEmployee

        java.util.ArrayList<ActivityLog> getActivityLogForEmployee(java.lang.String user)
                                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Takes a username string and queries the database to find a list of activity logs recorded from the corresponding staff account
        Parameters:
        user - : String specifying a username attribute of a staff record, in this case the account who's activity you want to see.
        Returns:
        ArrayList a list of ActivityLog objects ready for display on a TableView
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • addNewDishToMenuDB

        void addNewDishToMenuDB(java.lang.String name,
                        double cost)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Takes a name string and price double and inserts a new Food item into the menu table of the database.
        Parameters:
        name - : String input for the name of the new Food object you want to add to the menu
        cost - : double input specifying the price you want to charge for this new Food object in the menu
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • deleteDishFromMenuDB

        void deleteDishFromMenuDB(java.lang.String name,
                          double cost)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Takes a name string and price double then searches the table menu and and deletes the corresponding Food item from the menu table of the database.
        Parameters:
        name - : String input for the name of the Food object you want to delete from the menu
        cost - : double input specifying the price of the Food object you want removed from the menu
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • saveActivityEntryToDB

        public void saveActivityEntryToDB(java.lang.String user,
                                  java.lang.String act,
                                  java.lang.String timestamp)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Takes string inputs from the GUI prompts for the username, activity description, and time stamp, then inserts a new record with all of these into the activityLog table for managers to track.
        Overrides:
        saveActivityEntryToDB in class StaffScreenModel
        Parameters:
        user - : String specifying the username of a staff account
        act - : String describing an activity or action the user currently logged in has performed
        timestamp - : String formatted with the date and time the activity was performed
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getAllOrders

        java.util.ArrayList<Order> getAllOrders()
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Searches both stored orders and (working) orders tables for all of their records and returns an ArrayList containing every order in the system ready for display in a table
        Returns:
        ArrayList targetOrders: all the order objects in the system
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • saveImportToDB

        void saveImportToDB(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Order> csvImport)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Takes a list of order objects (in this context imported from a CSV file) and then saves each of them into the stored records table in the database
        Parameters:
        csvImport - : an ObservableList holding all of the orders you want to save to the stored orders table (orders in this context were read from a CSV file opened on the import page with a FileChooser)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
